# Assuming 'my_data' is your dataframe and it has been read from the Excel file

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
my_data = read.csv("average-hours-per-day-sp-Data.csv")
head(my_data)
```



:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p <- ggplot(my_data, aes(x = Activity)) +
  geom_bar(aes(y = Average.per.day..total, fill = "Total"), stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  geom_bar(aes(y = Average.per.day..men, fill = "Men"), stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  geom_bar(aes(y = Average.per.day..women, fill = "Women"), stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Total" = "blue", "Men" = "green", "Women" = "red")) +
  labs(title = "Average Time Spent on Daily Activities by Gender", 
       x = "Activity", 
       y = "Average Hours per Day", 
       fill = "Group") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
        plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))

print(p)
```
